data.title: English Teacher in American Life Kastamonu
data.meta_description: As a language teacher, your primary role will be to teach English to our students. You will be responsible for preparing lesson plans, creating presentations, developing language games, delivering English lessons for speaking, writing, and listening skills, and providing grammar lessons to the students. The working hours for this position are flexible and will vary based on the lesson plans. As a language teacher, you may be required to work at different times of the day to accommodate students' schedules. Therefore, each course you teach will be counted as working hours. However, you will have one day off every week and it will be on weekdays (Off day mostly could be Monday). We expect our interns to be energetic, enthusiastic, and have a positive attitude. A smile goes a long way in creating a friendly and welcoming learning environment for our students. As an English teacher, you will be responsible for creating a safe and supportive classroom environment where students can learn and grow.
data.text:
**Responsibilities:**

- Deliver engaging and interactive English language lessons to students of various levels and ages.

- Plan and prepare well-structured lessons that cater to students' individual needs and learning styles.

- Integrate technology and multimedia resources effectively into teaching materials and activities.

- Provide clear explanations and examples, and facilitate interactive discussions to enhance students' comprehension and language proficiency.

- Incorporate authentic materials and real-life scenarios to make language learning relevant and practical.

- Foster a supportive and inclusive learning environment, encouraging students to actively participate and collaborate with their peers.

- Assess students' language skills regularly through tests, assignments, and other evaluation methods.

- Provide constructive feedback and guidance to help students improve their language skills and reach their learning goals.

- Maintain accurate records of students' attendance, progress, and achievements.

- Communicate effectively with students' parents or guardians to provide updates on their progress and address any concerns.

- Stay updated on the latest teaching methodologies and resources in English language education.

- Participate in professional development opportunities and collaborate with fellow teachers to enhance teaching practices.

**Work Environment and Culture:**

At our language school, we value professionalism, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We believe in creating a supportive and student-focused environment where both teachers and students thrive. We encourage teamwork, open communication, and a commitment to personal and professional growth. Join our dynamic team and make a positive impact on students' language learning journeys.

Note: Working hours could be changable accoring to student's availability but the lesson in the week will be not more than 45 hours a week.
